Detailed Description

This class represents the concept of input-target data set for data modelling problems, such as function regression, pattern recognition and time series prediction.

See also:
SumSquaredError

MeanSquaredError

RootMeanSquaredError

NormalizedSquaredError

MinkowskiError

RegularizedMeanSquaredError

Definition at line 38 of file InputTargetDataSet.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::InputTargetDataSet::InputTargetDataSet ( int  newNumberOfSamples,
int  newNumberOfInputVariables,
int  newNumberOfTargetVariables 
)

General constructor. It creates an input-target data set object involving an input Matrix and an Target matrix. All input-target data is initialized to zero. It also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Name of input vaviables: InputVariable0,...
  • Name of target variables: TargetVariable0,...
  • Units of input vaviables: None.
  • Units of target variables: None.
  • Description of input vaviables: None.
  • Descritpion of target variables: None.
  • Display messages to screen: True.

Parameters:
newNumberOfSamples Number of samples in the data set.
newNumberOfInputVariables Number of input variables.
newNumberOfTargetVariables Number of target variables.

Definition at line 48 of file InputTargetDataSet.cpp.

Flood::InputTargetDataSet::InputTargetDataSet ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates an input-target data set object with zero samples and zero input and target variables. It also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Display messages to screen: True.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::addSample ( Vector< double >  sample  ) 

This method adds a new input-target sample to the input-target data set. Note that resizing is here necessary and therefore computationally expensive.

Parameters:
sample Input and target values of the sample to be added.
See also:
subtractSample(int).

Definition at line 358 of file InputTargetDataSet.cpp.

References Flood::Vector< Type >::getSize(), inputData, numberOfInputVariables, numberOfSamples, numberOfTargetVariables, and targetData.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::subtractSample ( int  sampleIndex  ) 

This method substract the input-target sample with a given index from the input-target data set. Note that resizing is here necessary and therefore computationally expensive.

Parameters:
sampleIndex Index of sample to be removed.
See also:
addSample(Vector<double>).

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::setInputTargetDataSet ( int  newNumberOfSamples,
int  newNumberOfInputVariables,
int  newNumberOfTargetVariables 
)

This method sets new numbers of samples and input and target variables in the input-target data set. It also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Name of input vaviables: InputVariable0,...
  • Name of target variables: TargetVariable0,...
  • Units of input vaviables: None.
  • Units of target variables: None.
  • Description of input vaviables: None.
  • Description of target variables: None.

Parameters:
newNumberOfSamples Number of samples.
newNumberOfInputVariables Number of input variables.
newNumberOfTargetVariables Number of target variables.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::setInputData ( Matrix< double >  newInputData  ) 

This method sets a new input data matrix. The number of rows must be equal to the number of samples. The number of columns must be equal to the number of input variables.

Parameters:
newInputData Input data matrix.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::setTargetData ( Matrix< double >  newTargetData  ) 

This method sets a new target data matrix. The number of rows must be equal to the number of samples. The number of columns must be equal to the number of target variables.

Parameters:
newTargetData Target data matrix.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::setInputAndTargetData ( Matrix< double >  newInputAndTargetData  ) 

This method sets both a new input set and a new target set from a single matrix. The number of rows must be equal to the number of samples. The number of columns must be equal to the total number of input and target variables.

Parameters:
newInputAndTargetData Input and target data matrix.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::preprocessMeanAndStandardDeviation ( void   ) 

This method preprocesses all input and target data so that the mean of all input and target variables is zero and their standard deviation is one. It then updates:

  • Input data matrix.
  • Target data matrix.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::preprocessMinimumAndMaximum ( void   ) 

This method preprocesses all input and target data so that the minimum of all input and target variables is -1 and their maximum is 1. It then updates:

  • Input data matrix.
  • Target data matrix.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::load ( char *  filename  ) 

This method loads the members of an input-target data set object from a data file:

  • Number of samples.
  • Number of input variables.
  • Number of target variables
  • Name of input variables.
  • Name of target variables.
  • Units of input variables.
  • Units of target variables.
  • Description of input variables.
  • Description of target variables.
  • Input data.
  • Target data.

Please mind about the file format. This is specified in the User's Guide.

filename Filename.

void Flood::InputTargetDataSet::saveAllStatistics ( char *  filename  ) 

This saves some basic statistics of the input-target data set to a data file. This includes:

  • Mean and standard deviation of input data.
  • Mean and standard deviation of target data.
  • Minimum and maximum of input data.
  • Minimum and maximum of target data.
